name: oracleDatabase
description: Get, add and update data in Oracle database

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete an entire table or rows in a table

options.name: Execute SQL
options.description: Execute an SQL

options.name: Insert
options.description: Insert rows in a table

options.name: Insert or Update
options.description: Insert or update rows in a table
options.action: Insert or update rows in a table

options.name: Select
options.description: Select rows from a table

options.name: Update
options.description: Update rows in a table

properties.name: schema
properties.description: The schema that contains the table you want to work on

properties.name: table
properties.description: The table you want to work on

options.name: Truncate
options.description: Only removes the table's data and preserves the table's structure

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete the rows that match the 'Select Rows' conditions below. If no selection is made, all rows in the table are deleted.

options.name: Drop
options.description: Deletes the table's data and also the table's structure permanently

properties.name: where
properties.description: If not set, all rows will be selected

values.name: column
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

values.name: condition
values.description: The operator to check the column against. When using 'LIKE' operator percent sign ( %) matches zero or more characters, underscore ( _ ) matches any single character.

values.name: value
values.description: Parameters to pass to the tool as JSON or string

properties.name: combineConditions
properties.description: How to combine the conditions defined in "Select Rows": AND requires all conditions to be true, OR requires at least one condition to be true

options.name: AND
options.description: Only rows that meet all the conditions are selected

options.name: OR
options.description: Rows that meet at least one condition are selected

options.name: autoCommit
options.description: Whether this property is true, then the transaction in the current connection is automatically committed at the end of statement execution

options.name: params
options.description: Enter the values for the bind parameters used in the statement

values.name: name
values.description: A bind variable placeholder identifier or numeral
values.placeholder: e.g. ``dept_id`` and ``dept_name`` are the two bind variables placeholders in this SQL statement

values.name: bindDirection
values.description: Specify whether data values bound to SQL or PL/SQL bind parameters are passed into, or out from, the database

values.name: valueVector
values.description: A JSON array of dimension values

values.name: valueBlob
values.description: A Binary data

options.name: dimensions
options.description: Total number of dimensions

options.name: indices
options.description: A JSON array of indices, e.g., [0, 2, 5]

options.name: values
options.description: A JSON array of values matching indices

values.name: parseInStatement
values.hint: If "Yes" the "Value" field should be a string of comma-separated values. i.e: 1,2,3 or str1,str2,str3

options.name: fetchArraySize
options.description: This property is a number that sets the size of an internal buffer used for fetching query rows from Oracle Database. Changing it may affect query performance but does not affect how many rows are returned to the application.

options.name: prefetchRows
options.description: This property is a query tuning option to set the number of additional rows the underlying Oracle driver fetches during the internal initial statement execution phase of a query

options.name: outputColumns
options.description: Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression

options.name: largeNumbersOutputAsString
options.description: Whether the numbers should be retrieved as string
options.hint: Applies to NUMBER, FLOAT, LONG type columns only

options.name: stmtBatching
Single Statement
options.description: A single Statement for all incoming items

options.name: Independently
options.description: Execute one Statement per incoming item of the run

options.name: Transaction
options.description: Execute all Statements in a transaction, if a failure occurs, all changes are rolled back
The way queries should be sent to the database

options.name: stmtBatching
Single Statement
options.description: A single Statement for all incoming items

options.name: Independently
options.description: Execute one Statement per incoming item of the run

options.name: Transaction
options.description: Execute all Statements in a transaction, if a failure occurs, all changes are rolled back
The way queries should be sent to the database

properties.name: stmtBatchingNotice
properties.displayName: Important: Single Statement mode works only for the first item

properties.name: query
properties.description: The SQL statement to execute. You can use n8n expressions and positional parameters like :1, :2, :3, or named parameters like :name, :ID, etc to refer to the 'Bind Variable Placeholder Values' set in options below.

options.name: autoCommit
options.description: Whether this property is true, then the transaction in the current connection is automatically committed at the end of statement execution

options.name: params
options.description: Enter the values for the bind parameters used in the statement

values.name: name
values.description: A bind variable placeholder identifier or numeral
values.placeholder: e.g. ``dept_id`` and ``dept_name`` are the two bind variables placeholders in this SQL statement

values.name: bindDirection
values.description: Specify whether data values bound to SQL or PL/SQL bind parameters are passed into, or out from, the database

values.name: valueVector
values.description: A JSON array of dimension values

values.name: valueBlob
values.description: A Binary data

options.name: dimensions
options.description: Total number of dimensions

options.name: indices
options.description: A JSON array of indices, e.g., [0, 2, 5]

options.name: values
options.description: A JSON array of values matching indices

values.name: parseInStatement
values.hint: If "Yes" the "Value" field should be a string of comma-separated values. i.e: 1,2,3 or str1,str2,str3

options.name: fetchArraySize
options.description: This property is a number that sets the size of an internal buffer used for fetching query rows from Oracle Database. Changing it may affect query performance but does not affect how many rows are returned to the application.

options.name: prefetchRows
options.description: This property is a query tuning option to set the number of additional rows the underlying Oracle driver fetches during the internal initial statement execution phase of a query

options.name: outputColumns
options.description: Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression

options.name: largeNumbersOutputAsString
options.description: Whether the numbers should be retrieved as string
options.hint: Applies to NUMBER, FLOAT, LONG type columns only

Single Statement
options.description: A single Statement for all incoming items

options.name: Independently
options.description: Execute one Statement per incoming item of the run

options.description: Execute all Statements in a transaction, if a failure occurs, all changes are rolled back
